column2: How to help victims of the earthquake in Turkey and Syria

column1: More than 48,000 people are dead and tens of thousands injured after a massive earthquake rocked Turkey and Syria early on February 6. The magnitude 7.8 quake was one of the strongest to strike the area in more than a century, with Turkey’s Disaster and Emergency Management Agency (AFAD) calling for international help. A magnitude 6.3 aftershock struck southern Turkey Monday, injuring hundreds more as the region continues to dig out from the rubble.

column2: How to help victims of the earthquake in Turkey and Syria

column1: The International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies (IFRC) launched immediate cash assistance from its Disaster Response Emergency Fund to help relief efforts in both countries.

column2: How to help victims of the earthquake in Turkey and Syria

column1: Many other organizations are also on the ground responding. You can help by clicking here or on the button below.
